com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom
Class SphericalGeometry

java.lang.Object
  com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom.AbstractGeometry
      com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom.SphericalGeometry
All Implemented Interfaces:
Geometry
public class SphericalGeometry
extends AbstractGeometry
implements Geometry

Class implementing a spherical geometry. Concrete class providing a flat geometry (a sphere with nominal radius 1, equator in the XY-plane, Z axis through the poles).

Version:
$Id: SphericalGeometry.java,v 1.4 2006/07/06 06:58:35 martin Exp $
Author:
martin

Method Detail

getHeight

public float getHeight(XYZ p)
Get the height of a given point in this geometry. Height is relative to the surface of the unit radius sphere.

Specified by:
getHeight in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point representing the coordinates to be queried
Returns:
The height of the specified point relative to assumed sea level at 1.0

setHeight

public void setHeight(XYZ p,
                      float v)
Set the height of a point in this geometry. The height set is relative to the surface of the unit radius sphere.

Specified by:
setHeight in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point with the height that is to be set
v - The new height to assign (relative to 1.0 being sea level)

getMidpoint

public XYZ getMidpoint(XYZ v0,
                       XYZ v1)
Get the midpoint between two points in this geometry. Don't just take the mid-point of the straight-line path through the sphere's surface: must work relative to the sphere's surface.

Specified by:
getMidpoint in interface Geometry
Parameters:
v0 - The first point
v1 - The second point
Returns:
The midpoint between the two points

getNormalisedLatitude

public float getNormalisedLatitude(XYZ p)
Get the normalised latitude for a point in this geometry. Normalised latitude is 1.0 at the north pole, -1.0 at the south pole

Specified by:
getNormalisedLatitude in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point to get the latitude for
Returns:
The normalised latitude of the point

up

public XYZ up(XYZ p)
Returns unit z vector for a particular point. Up is normal to the sphere.

Specified by:
up in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point to get the unit Z vector for
Returns:
The unit Z vector for this point

north

public XYZ north(XYZ p)
Returns unit y vector for a particular point. North is perpendicular to "up" and "east" WARNING: Returns zero vector at the poles.

Specified by:
north in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point to get the unit Z vector for
Returns:
The unit Y vector for this point

east

public XYZ east(XYZ p)
Returns unit x vector for a particular point. East is perpendicular to "up" and the polar vector. WARNING: Returns zero vector at the poles.

Specified by:
east in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point to get the unit X vector for
Returns:
The unit X vector for this point

perturb

public XYZ perturb(XYZ p,
                   XYZ variation)
Adds a random peturbation to a point up to the specified amount

Specified by:
perturb in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point to be subjected to peturbation
variation - The maximum amount of random variation to appy
Returns:
A new peturbed point. The input value is not modified

epsilon

public float epsilon()
Return the error tolerance for this geometry. This needs to return something small for the lake flooding algorithm to work.

Specified by:
epsilon in interface Geometry
Returns:
The error tolerance for this geometry.
